posts.post_content:
He's tailor-made for EDH, and it shows. He is very, very good but does not seem broken in the format, like Animar does. He was clearly designed as a build-around card, but the good part is that what you can build around him is not so well-defined. You can run the token-deck route, the +1/+1 counter route, the heavy sacrifice/death trigger route, and probably a few others. Let's start by listing cards he is ridiculous with:  
[Sigil Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sigil Captain): All the Saprolings you can pay for and subsequently huge creatures.  
[Juniper Order Ranger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juniper Order Ranger): Al the Saprolings you can pay for, and no sacrificing before you get a huge creature  
[Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter): Decent since you can pay ![Variable Colorless](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=X&type=symbol) to kill something with toughness X or less, Vish himself gets huge for cheap, nuts with Juniper Order Ranger and/or Sigil Captain. Potentially -4/-4 for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) if you've got both.  
[Skullclamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skullclamp)/[Fecundity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fecundity): Hahahaha. Hahahaha! HAHAH... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
He's tailor-made for EDH, and it shows. He is very, very good but does not seem broken in the format, like Animar does. He was clearly designed as a build-around card, but the good part is that what you can build around him is not so well-defined. You can run the token-deck route, the +1/+1 counter route, the heavy sacrifice/death trigger route, and probably a few others. Let's start by listing cards he is ridiculous with:
Sigil Captain: All the Saprolings you can pay for and subsequently huge creatures.
Juniper Order Ranger: Al the Saprolings you can pay for, and no sacrificing before you get a huge creature
Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter: Decent since you can pay to kill something with toughness X or less, Vish himself gets huge for cheap, nuts with Juniper Order Ranger and/or Sigil Captain. Potentially -4/-4 for if you've got both.
Skullclamp/Fecundity: Hahahaha. Hahahaha! HAHAH... (see all)

posts.post_content: Out of all the Precon EDH general's, Ghave is by far my favorite. He's cheap, He boosts your creatures, and he gives you tokens. What's not to love? And because he's a big creepy looking guy, I decided to build around that theme. And what I got was an Infect EDH deck that Reanimates, Spawns, Kills, Life Gain, and literally sucks the life out of you as it grows in power. Just like a Diseased Fungus would do.

posts.post_content:
To all people who don't see why this is three colours, I think I've got it figured out:  
  
He's Green, White and Black.  
  
He comes into play with five +1/+1 counters. This makes him big and symbolises growth. Which is green.  
  
He can remove counters from some creatures to create others. Those creatures sacrifice personal strength to contribute to the community, or the greater good. Which is white.  
  
He can sacrifice creatures to add to the strength of others. Which is black.
posts.html:
To all people who don't see why this is three colours, I think I've got it figured out:

He's Green, White and Black.

He comes into play with five +1/+1 counters. This makes him big and symbolises growth. Which is green.

He can remove counters from some creatures to create others. Those creatures sacrifice personal strength to contribute to the community, or the greater good. Which is white.

He can sacrifice creatures to add to the strength of others. Which is black.

posts.post_content: How has no one caught onto incorporating proliferate with this guy? The wording states "choose any number of target permanents or players with counters on them." All of your creatures can be targets for proliferation. It doesn't even limit the kind of counters-- +1/+1, fungus, infect counters on your opponents/ their creatures, whatever. [Contagion Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contagion Engine) becomes both offensive and defensive, and it grows your army exponentially.
posts.html:
How has no one caught onto incorporating proliferate with this guy? The wording states "choose any number of target permanents or players with counters on them." All of your creatures can be targets for proliferation. It doesn't even limit the kind of counters-- +1/+1, fungus, infect counters on your opponents/ their creatures, whatever. Contagion Engine becomes both offensive and defensive, and it grows your army exponentially.

posts.post_content: Going is infinite is one thing, making busted 2 card combos is slightly better since its more consistant. Not saying going infinite is not doable just seems easier fetching a single card and abusing the synergy out of it than setting up a 3 card combo which is a tad fragile. [Ivy Lane Denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ivy Lane Denizen) means for 1 mana you produce a 1/1 without loss. My personal favorite is comboing with [Vhati il-Dal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vhati il-Dal) - they attack, you spam a 1/1 and make the attacking creature a toughness of 1 and just chump... not even just vhati and [Deathspore Thallid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathspore Thallid). The trick with Ghave is not only to include cards that combo with it but make sure those cards can combo with each other.
posts.html:
Going is infinite is one thing, making busted 2 card combos is slightly better since its more consistant. Not saying going infinite is not doable just seems easier fetching a single card and abusing the synergy out of it than setting up a 3 card combo which is a tad fragile. Ivy Lane Denizen means for 1 mana you produce a 1/1 without loss. My personal favorite is comboing with Vhati il-Dal - they attack, you spam a 1/1 and make the attacking creature a toughness of 1 and just chump... not even just vhati and Deathspore Thallid. The trick with Ghave is not only to include cards that combo with it but make sure those cards can combo with each other.

"Hi there, Ghave. This is my friend, [Corpsejack Menace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpsejack Menace). I thought you guys might get along."
